author: dhiaslm
content:
hey volks, I am trying to start a validator node on pyrmont using eth1 infura endpoint but it looks like that the beacon node is failing as it keeps sending this error:

ERRO Failed to update eth1 cache             error: Failed to update eth1 cache: GetDepositLogsFailed("Eth1 node returned error: {\"code\":-32005,\"message\":\"query returned more than 10000 results\"}"), retry_millis: 7000, service: eth1_rpc

this is the command i used to start the beacon node:
lighthouse bn -d <local-dir>  --testnet pyrmont --staking --eth1-endpoint <https://infura-endpoint>

my validator account is already "inactive" and failing it's duties thus being slashed. 
anyone could tell what am i doing wrong?

author: protolambda
content: Lighthouse has a flag to adjust how many blocks are queried per api call. Make it lower, and you get less log results per call, and it will work.

author: protolambda
content: Try the lighthouse or ethstaker discord for more help.

author: dhiaslm
content: p.s the same "bn" command without --testnet pyrmont flag is starting the beacon node on medalla (per default) sending back sync messages without any problem !!

author: protolambda
content: Yea, different testnet, different deposit contract, with less events per second. Pyrmont was started with 100.000 deposits, executed within half a day. That's a lot of logs per block

author: protolambda
content: Also, update to latest lighthouse. Mainnet should become default I think

author: dhiaslm
content: so i randomly changed this flag --eth1-blocks-per-log-query 100 (default is 1000 according to the --help menu) and it works without that error now. thanks for the help!
